instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
This boardis trolling me nicely.

I doint know history of the board, its come from a long line of have a go repair shops. However thge board looked intact and not to dicked about with.

At first, there was no chime. But ALL the power rails.

I reflashed the bios, still no chime.

I then replaced the SMC, Now i get a chime. usb mouse illuminates, and I can PRAM reset. Still no image on external or internal screens.

I have 0.9V on GPUvcore, and all other power rails are within spec.

Im not sure what else to try.

Any hints, i know this one is going to suck.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message: External video present? Known good LCD? Inspect cable and connector.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Hey Duke,

LCD is good, All cables look perfect, and nothing on internal or external.

Mux Area looks perfect.

Should I reball <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> before starting to messaboutwith GPU swaps ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
No you don't just reball anything without diagnosis.....

Used the correct SMC from identical board? <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image
threads.message:
Mark this as solved.

Replacement SMC came from usual donor board, however looks like someone already swapped it. So correct SMC from used and we have image.

Give away was it would only chime on power adapter, no chime when powered via battery. This prompted another go for SMC change.
